* Brand: HP
* Make : Pavilion
* Model: dv9074ea
* Website: http://www.hp.com

=== Current Issues ===

* booting
** booting stalls
** boot option 'noapic' helps
** might be related to kernel bugs <nowiki>[[http://bugzilla.kernel.org/show_bug.cgi?id=8195|8195]]</nowiki>, <nowiki>[[http://bugzilla.kernel.org/show_bug.cgi?id=8186|8186]]</nowiki> and <nowiki>[[http://bugzilla.kernel.org/show_bug.cgi?id=7894|7894]]</nowiki>; see also the discussion in http://www.linuxforums.org/forum/linux-laptops/75587-linux-hp-dv6000-amd-laptops.html
* hibernate (suspend to disk)
** kernel panics when trying to hibernate
** with the additional boot option 'nosmp' hibernate and resume works (that is, no symmetric multiprocessing in the dual core processor :-/ )
* sleep (suspend to RAM)
** machine hangs when trying to put to sleep
** with the additional boot option 'nosmp' the machine goes to sleep, the sleep light comes on, it wakes up on a key press, but the screen is just blank and the keyboard is not working (for example caps lock and num lock)
** might be related to kernel bugs <nowiki>[[http://bugzilla.kernel.org/show_bug.cgi?id=6961|6961]]</nowiki> and <nowiki>[[http://bugzilla.kernel.org/show_bug.cgi?id=6058|6058]]</nowiki>
* error messages in dmesg
** PCI: BIOS BUG #81[49435000] found
** PCI: Failed to allocate mem resource #6:20000@e0000000 for 0000:05:00.0 (similar to bug <nowiki>[[https://bugs.launchpad.net/linux/+bug/54294|54294]]</nowiki> in launchpad)

==== Notes ====

The testing was done with the i386 desktop image (live CD) of each release. 

7.04 Feisty
* Installation: additional boot option 'noapic' (+ corresponding change in /boot/grub/menu.lst)
* Hibernate: works if adding boot option 'nosmp', otherwise the kernel panics when trying to hibernate
* Sleep: with the additonal 'nosmp' boot option, the machine goes to sleep, the sleep light comes on, it wakes up on a key press, but the screen is just blank and the keyboard is not working (for example caps lock and num lock)
* Wireless NIC: the Broadcom 4312 card is partly working with the linux driver after extracting the firmware with bcm43xx-fwcutter (WEP working, but it's slow, WPA not working), see also https://help.ubuntu.com/community/WifiDocs/Driver/bcm43xx
<pre>
sudo apt-get install bcm43xx-fwcutter
</pre>
* Infrared: only working with the laptop's remote control (same as in MS Windows)
* 3D acceleration: only with the restricted nvidia driver

6.10 Edgy
* Installation: additional boot option 'noapic' (+ corresponding change in /boot/grub/menu.lst)
* Sleep: the machine goes to sleep, the sleep light comes on, it wakes up on a key press, but the screen is just blank and the keyboard is not working (for example caps lock and num lock)
* Infrared: only working with the laptop's remote control (same as in MS Windows)
* Multimedia touch key 'Volume Mute': does mute and unmute, but doesn't change color between red and blue according to status
* Play/Pause key: only pause, does not play
* 3D acceleration: only with the restricted nvidia driver

6.06 LTS Drapper
* Installation: additional boot option 'noapic' (+ corresponding change in /boot/grub/menu.lst)
* Sleep: no option in menu, Fn + F5 not working either
* Wired NIC: not working out-of-the-box
* Infrared: only working with the laptop's remote control (same as in MS Windows)
* Multimedia touch key 'Volume Mute': does mute and unmute, but doesn't change color between red and blue according to status
* 3D acceleration: only with the restricted nvidia driver
